content: Learn and perform a traditional South African dance move (e.g., Zulu dance, Gumboot dance) for the group.
Recite the first stanza of the South African national anthem in a language other than your first language.
Name and explain the significance of three national symbols of South Africa.
Demonstrate how to properly pronounce three South African place names with clicks (e.g., Qunu, Xhosa, KwaZulu-Natal).
Share a traditional proverb or saying from your culture and explain its meaning to the group.
Describe the process of making a traditional South African dish (e.g., bobotie, chakalaka, or pap).
Identify and explain the cultural significance of three items found in a traditional South African beadwork pattern.
Demonstrate how to properly greet someone in three different South African languages.
Name and describe three indigenous plants used in traditional South African medicine.
Explain the historical significance of the Cradle of Humankind and its importance to South African heritage.
Describe the symbolism behind the South African flag's colors and design.
Share a short folktale or legend from one of South Africa's indigenous cultures.
Demonstrate how to tie a traditional South African head wrap (doek) or explain its cultural significance.
Name and describe three traditional South African musical instruments.
Explain the concept of 'Ubuntu' and give an example of how it applies in everyday life.
Describe the significance of the 'Big Five' in South African wildlife and culture.
Share three interesting facts about a South African historical figure (e.g., Nelson Mandela, Steve Biko, Desmond Tutu).
Explain the importance of the 'braai' in South African culture and describe what typically happens at one.
Name and describe three traditional South African games or sports.
Share the meaning behind your name or a traditional naming custom from your culture.
Describe the role of a sangoma in traditional South African culture.
Explain the significance of lobola in South African marriage traditions.
Name and describe three UNESCO World Heritage Sites in South Africa.
Share three words unique to South African English (e.g., 'lekker', 'eish', 'shame') and explain their meanings.
Describe the traditional attire of one South African cultural group and explain its significance.
Explain the importance of oral tradition in preserving South African heritage.
Name and describe three significant South African fossils or paleontological discoveries.
Share three interesting facts about the history and cultural significance of Table Mountain.
Describe the role of cattle in traditional South African cultures.
Explain the significance of the 'Indaba tree' in South African culture and decision-making processes.
